Present were Mrs. Harry Rubin, Miss McCormack, Miss Alice R. H. Smith, Miss Harriett Frampton, R. H. Staats, Albert Simons, Samuel G. Stoney, outre Briggs , E. B. Chamberain, Juian Mitchell, Jr., Bevery Jackson, R. N. S. Whitelaw and Homer M. place, President.   The Chairman caed on Mr. Whitelaw who asked Mrs. Rubin if she wished to speak first. Mrs . Mr. Whitelaw reported that the Committee" s off-street parking plan had been presented to City Council on November 13th and that no action had boon taken with the exception of the appointment of a committee of 8 from City Counci. Mr. place suggosted that the present membership and organization of the committee not be atered for the current year. There being no further business the meeting adjourned at 5:55.
